highlights: Spring Boot 3.5 + Java 17 backend that now covers catalog, order, inventory, payment, and outbox modules behind clean controller/service/repository layers
All aggregates extend BaseEntity to inherit UUID identifiers plus auditing timestamps, so Category/Product/Order/Payment records stay consistent out of the box
OrderServiceImpl runs inside a READ_COMMITTED transaction, loads each Product, enforces inventory availability, calculates totals, and flips Orders to PAID as soon as payment succeeds
Inventory is modeled as a one-to-one record per Product with @Version-based optimistic locking and descriptive InsufficientStockException / InventoryNotFoundException errors
PaymentService persists Payment rows, updates the Order status, and emits PaymentCompletedEvent payloads as serialized JSON into the outbox table
An OutboxPublisher scheduled task (dev profile) streams unprocessed events to Kafka topic payment.events and stamps processedAt to prevent duplicate sends
Flyway migrations V1â€“V3 build the catalog tables, add orders + inventory + payments, and introduce the outbox_event table with a partial index for efficient polling
application-dev wires local Postgres + Kafka while application-test keeps Flyway enabled so Testcontainers integration tests boot the schema exactly like dev
Global validation annotations plus ApiErrorResponse/GlobalExceptionHandler standardize error payloads for Catalog and Order APIs
Dev-only CatalogManualTestRunner seeds data and OrderConcurrencyDemoRunner races two threads against the same inventory row to showcase stock protection
